sn55.39:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.
sn55.39:4.2: Then the Buddha got dressed in the morning and, taking his bowl and robes, went to the home of Kāḷigodhā the Sakyan lady,
sn55.39:4.3: where he sat on the indicated seat.
sn55.39:4.4: Then Kāḷigodhā went up to the Buddha,
sn55.39:4.5: bowed, and sat down to one side.
sn55.39:5.1: “Godhā, a female noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.39:5.3: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.39:5.8: And they live at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
sn55.39:5.9: A female noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
sn55.39:6.1: “Sir, these four factors of stream-entry that were taught by the Buddha are found in me, and I embody them.
sn55.39:6.2: For I have experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.39:6.7: And I share without reservation all the gifts available to give in our family with those who are ethical and of good character.”
sn55.39:6.9: You have declared the fruit of stream-entry.”
